cause.description:
Grist exists to tell the untold stories, spotlight trends before they become trendy, and engage the apathetic. We're fiercely independent in our coverage; we throw brickbats when they're needed and bestow kudos when they're warranted. And while we take our work seriously, we don't take ourselves seriously, because of the many things this planet is running out of, sanctimonious tree-huggers ain't one of them.
Grist is based in the Emerald City of Seattle, in the Evergreen State of Washington (see the green theme?), with contributors scattered the world 'round. We are a nonprofit organization funded by foundation grants, reader contributions, and just a touch of advertising. Our website and email services are free -- and worth every penny.
Grist: it's gloom and doom with a sense of humor. So laugh now -- or the planet gets it.
1. • Grist provides a home to environmental journalists dedicated to breaking down the complex issues.
2. • You've got questions, we've got answers. Ask Umbra tackles all your eco-conundrums.
3. • Grist informs our readers, inspires our leaders and exalts the changemakers in our community.
4. • Grist is a nonprofit. That means we rely on the support of our readers like you, not corporate dollars.
5. • You look for a sense of humor in the person you're dating. Why not your environmental news source?
cause.mission: To take environmental activism and journalism mainstream.
cause.name: Support environmental news and commentary
